item.title: mlbgame Release
item.description:
I have finally released the first official version of mlbgame, which is a python API that returns MLB game information.

I started development on this project in early November, and finally released it about a week ago. As of writing this, the current version is 1.0.3, with a few bug fixes from the initial release (one of which I discovered while writing this article).

The full source code can be accessed on GitHub (leave a star), with new developments being worked on in the dev branch.

The full documentation for mlbgame is available here.

I was inspired...

item.title: New Website
item.description:
So I just set up this new website with a new theme, which is hosted on GitHub.

However, becuase GitHub does not allow custom plugins for Jekyll, I have to do a little bit of extra work than just uploading the Jekyll files to the repository.

The code that I use to generate the website code is stored in the source branch of the repository (currently default branch).

GitHub uses the master branch of a repository to publish to a website, so I have to generate the html files on my own before I upload them.

This is...
